medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent rectal bleeding lasting for 2 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms of intermittent rectal bleeding began 2 months ago after a six-month course of androgen deprivation therapy and subsequent radiotherapy for prostate cancer. Initial conservative management provided temporary relief but rectal urgency and intermittent small amounts of rectal bleeding persisted. Treatment with a novel enema formulation led to improvement within one week, with cessation of rectal bleeding and only mild remaining proctitis symptoms after additional therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a past medical history of type 2 diabetes and hypertension, benign prostatic hypertrophy, and prostate adenocarcinoma with a Gleason score of 4 + 3 on the left side and 3 + 4 on the right side.
